meanings.definition: Fail to fulfill a promise or obligation.
meanings.sent1: She kept reneging on her promise to help with the project.
meanings.sent2: He is known for reneging on his commitments at the last minute.
meanings.sent3: The student tried reneging on his homework but got caught.
meanings.sent4: The company was accused of reneging on its agreement with the workers.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of reneging on the contract were severe.

meanings.definition: Go back on a promise or commitment.
meanings.sent1: They regret reneging on their agreement to attend the event.
meanings.sent2: After reneging on his promise, he lost the trust of his friends.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to be reneging on its decision to nap and suddenly ran off.
meanings.sent4: The politician was criticized for reneging on his campaign promises.
meanings.sent5: The feeling of guilt lingered after reneging on the deal.
